item.title: White Eyes is better than it sounds here
item.content:encoded:
White Eyes doesn't just mark an incorrect direction once, but on every single room.

Legacy gives you a pass on 1 room. Leaving without allies, 9 right out of 45 remaining choice options on the road. Good choice.

Red Eyes gives you 3 passes on mistakes. Leaving without allies, 10 right out of 47 remaining choice options on the road. Terrible choice.

White eyes marks 1 off on each. Leaving without allies, 10 right out 40 choice options on the way, and your chance of guessing right on any room goes from 20 percent to 25 percent.

Olmek removes 1 choice option. You also get 3 free choice options. Brings you down to 36.

Tacos I've had activate every time once and only once. Not sure if she can do more or less, but this removes 4 choices and gives you 1 guarentee. Combo'd with Olmek it leaves you with needing to guess 9 right choices out of 32 to get to room 11. Not a sure win of course, but pretty good odds.

I haven't found the other allies reliable for activating. Snakeman removes 1 choice each time he activates. Spot if he activates drops it to 8 right choices out of 28.

Add the billymaze script, and it will correctly give you the back half of the maze.

Not sure if anything gives better odds than that, but there's my ramble. White Eyes is definitely the right choice for billymaze provided your target is to finish it.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
I have found that you can use simple probability theory to increase your chances of guessing right as you proceed down the maze.

I'll outline how I walk the maze here, structured the same way I put the lines into notepad. An Area generally looks like this at first-

1 E: ?N, ?W, ?E, XS, XJ

I outline in order; what Area it is, where I entered from, the 5 choices (J for ninja, because N is north), and whether or not I know the direction is good via ? (For unknown) and ! (For correct way.)

The trick is to, once you get about 4-5 Areas in, start keeping track of what direction and slot have been used overall. If my first 5 Areas are as follows:

1 E: !N, XW, XE, XS, XJ
2 N: !J, XE, XS, XN, XW
3 S: XS, !N, XE, XW, XJ
4 W: XJ, XN, XE, !S, XW
5 E: !E, XW, XS, XJ, XN

and I get a 6th area as such (I'll pretend to be WhiteEye here):
6 S: ?S, ?J, XW, ?N, ?E

Than a trick I use is to count how many each slot and direction have been used. In this case, we get the following:
11241
NJNSE
We can see that slots 3 and 5 haven't been used yet. We can also see that West has not been an exit yet either. And in this fake area 6, we have a slot 3 W open. There's a much higher chance that the unused 3W is the right one than, say, the 4N because we have gotten a slot 4 already and 2 Norths.

The logic will be defeated by the RNG sometimes. In fact on my foray back out to find out how much Ryo you get, I did not have a single exit in the third slot on the way in for the entire maze. But by using this logic, I have reached, and will probably do so every time, the end of the maze as WhiteEye with no allies and only a 512 stamina GiT where when I was new at it I failed twice as a RedEye with the 2k+ GiTs and full allies.

Also, I'm fairly certain the room you're "sent to" upon failing is nothing more than a random from Area 1 to the area you're on. I don't really think failures in the maze do anything but make you use GiTs, especially since with a perfect log of the maze you should never repeat a failed direction.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
There are 2 keys to successfully completing the maze:
1) Write down each correct direction. The right way never changes except from month to month.
2) Write down which direction you entered the room from, and which of the 5 options that direction is.

For example:
you enter Area 1 from the South..
East West South Ninja North

Remember South, and that the 3rd option was South. This is EXTREMELY important for getting out of the maze.

There are 11 Areas. Once you reach Area 11, you snatch the prize and then have to escape from the maze. You're automatically sent back to Area 10. Once you get there, though… ALL text will have changed to a string of AAAAAA.

The way to get out is to follow the directions you entered the area from.

If you entered Area 10 from the East, you need to go East, which means you also need to know which of the 5 AAAA directions actually IS East. Repeat this 10 times, and you've escaped the maze.

Which means the REAL hard part is figuring out the first 10 Directions through trial and error.
